div.a: Pictures From Inside The Former U.S. Embassy In Iran

div.div: Here's a look inside the former U.S. embassy in Iran as it stands today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WWZwXC&via=Digg&text=Pictures From Inside The Former U.S. Embassy In Iran

div.a: Why American Airlines Chose Samsung Over Apple When It Bought 17,000 Tablets

div.div: American Airlines owns 33,000 tablets and that's one of the largest corporate deployments, period. 23,000 of them are from Samsung, not Apple.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVyHD9&via=Digg&text=Why American Airlines Chose Samsung Over Apple When It Bought 17,000 Tablets

div.a: What Should You Read?

div.div: The world is filled with millions of great stories, but let's face it: it's hard to find a moment to read even one. Storyville makes sure you spend your precious reading time with only the best, award-winning work.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y2GS0T&via=Digg&text=What Should You Read?

div.a: Before And After Portraits That Show The Effects Of Time And Aging

div.div: For her project titled “Identities,” London-based photographer Ana Oliveira created a series of before and after photos that show the effects of time and aging.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WfGajr&via=Digg&text=Before And After Portraits That Show The Effects Of Time And Aging

div.div: DON'T WORRY, FIRING SQUADS ARE PLAN B

div.a: Saudi Arabia May Stop Beheadings Due To Swordsmen Shortages

div.div: Oil-rich kingdom mulls abolition of beheading in favour of firing squads for capital punishments due to reported shortages of government swordsmen.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XcVmRh&via=Digg&text=Saudi Arabia May Stop Beheadings Due To Swordsmen Shortages

div.a: How One Boring Company Pulled Off The Perfect SXSW Troll

div.div: Aside from plaid-clad hipsters and mountains of barbecue, every South by Southwest attendee is sure to see one thing: Completely idiotic startup marketing campaigns.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VXSyFV&via=Digg&text=How One Boring Company Pulled Off The Perfect SXSW Troll

div.a: Animal Bites Football Player During Match

div.div: A ferret bolted onto a soccer field and proceeded to bite one of the players when he tried to capture it. Our apologies regarding the unnecessary "Harlem Shake" background music.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YUJTPV&via=Digg&text=Animal Bites Football Player During Match

div.a: The iPhone's Biggest Flaw

div.div: The iPhone has a flaw, and it’s not a minor one. In fact, it affects every single one of the over 100 million sold so far, and there is no real solution yet in sight. The iPhone’s battery sucks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10kqgEc&via=Digg&text=The iPhone's Biggest Flaw

div.a: 'The Punisher': Russia's Dash Cam Driver You Don't Want To Cut Off

div.div: Dubbed "The Punisher," Alexei Volkov takes a zero-tolerance approach to being cut off while driving his bus on Russia's roads.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YU7BvC&via=Digg&text='The Punisher': Russia's Dash Cam Driver You Don't Want To Cut Off

div.a: Which Encryption Apps Are Strong Enough To Help You Take Down A Government?

div.div: It seems like these days I can't eat breakfast without reading about some new encryption app that will (supposedly) revolutionize our communications — while making tyrannical regimes fall like cheap confetti.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10zJQA9&via=Digg&text=Which Encryption Apps Are Strong Enough To Help You Take Down A Government?

div.a: Chess National Master Falls For Newbie Opening And Reacts In The Best Way Possible

div.div: A Redditor unearthed a neat video where a chess national master falls for a beginner's trap. The reaction was pretty priceless.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14IKHeG&via=Digg&text=Chess National Master Falls For Newbie Opening And Reacts In The Best Way Possible

div.a: Google Glass Photoshopped Onto Historical Figures

div.div: Some users on The Verge's forums photoshopped Google Glass onto historical figures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZvIvaK&via=Digg&text=Google Glass Photoshopped Onto Historical Figures

div.div: FATHER, SON AND THE HOLY CLOAK

div.a: When The Pope Is Chosen, His Tailors Will Be Ready

div.div: For a select group of Catholics, the news most eagerly awaited from the conclave of cardinals gathering in Rome to elect a new pope is less about who that man is than how big. They are the craftsmen of Ditta Annibale Gammarelli, papal tailors since the 18th century.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13NjAU3&via=Digg&text=When The Pope Is Chosen, His Tailors Will Be Ready

div.a: How To Resurrect Lost Species

div.div: Will we ever see a woolly mammoth again? What about the striped Tasmanian tiger, once-prolific passenger pigeon, or the imposing wild cattle called aurochs?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y8JEE7&via=Digg&text=How To Resurrect Lost Species

div.a: When Going To The Office Makes You A Better Dad Than Working From Home

div.div: A conversation about the benefits and drawbacks of Yahoo's new policy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12A4Vvz&via=Digg&text=When Going To The Office Makes You A Better Dad Than Working From Home

div.a: A Look At The Artistry Of Cigar Accoutrements

div.div: “I don’t think people realize that in this day of automation ... there’s still a real craftsmanship and artistry that goes into something of this quality and magnitude,” says Matt Krimm, co-owner of the W. Curtis Draper cigar shop.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/16gPCH9&via=Digg&text=A Look At The Artistry Of Cigar Accoutrements

div.a: New 'Star Trek Into Darkness' Trailer

div.div: Here's a new trailer for 'Star Trek Into Darkness'.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zpis1D&via=Digg&text=New 'Star Trek Into Darkness' Trailer

div.a: How A U.S. Citizen Came To Be In America's Cross Hairs

div.div: One morning in late September 2011, a group of American drones took off from an airstrip the C.I.A. had built in the remote southern expanse of Saudi Arabia.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/16joEi6&via=Digg&text=How A U.S. Citizen Came To Be In America's Cross Hairs

div.a: Embroidered Photographs That Illustrate The Failures Of Photography

div.div: Diane Meyer’s “Time Spent That Might Otherwise Be Forgotten” project isn’t so much about what photography can do, but rather what photography can’t do.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xz4AoR&via=Digg&text=Embroidered Photographs That Illustrate The Failures Of Photography

div.div: MORE STEFON, THAT'S ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW

div.a: The Best Of Last Night's SNL With Justin Timberlake

div.div: The show pulled out all the stops this week to redeem itself from its recent slump, with a slew of cameos by SNL greats, including Dan Aykroyd, Candice Bergen, Alec Baldwin, Steve Martin, Chevy Chase, Martin Short, Tom Hanks, and others.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XzTIXQ&via=Digg&text=The Best Of Last Night's SNL With Justin Timberlake

div.div: WE GET OLDER, BUT THEY STAY THE SAME AGE

div.a: 16 Photographs That Capture The Best And Worst Of 1970s America

div.div: A new exhibit at the National Archives highlights an interesting decade—one that gave rise to the environmental movement and some awkward fashion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0s1ah&via=Digg&text=16 Photographs That Capture The Best And Worst Of 1970s America

div.a: Pirate Bay Ad Appears On Hacked Billboard

div.div: A group of hackers have managed to gain access to a prominently placed advertising billboard located in the crowded Republic Square in the center of Belgrade, Serbia.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10quoCF&via=Digg&text=Pirate Bay Ad Appears On Hacked Billboard

div.a: Father Hacks Donkey Kong For Daughter To Save Mario As Pauline

div.div: Game developer and father Mike Mika hacked a 2010 Nintendo ROM of Donkey Kong to give his daughter the chance to save Mario instead of playing as him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZviJUj&via=Digg&text=Father Hacks Donkey Kong For Daughter To Save Mario As Pauline

div.div: BABE: PIG IN THE BIG TIGER

div.a: Feeding Time

div.div: This was feeding day, so I chose the largest tiger to take pictures of. Despite being caged up, he still maintained the instincts of being in the wild. I waited for the animal keeper to feed the tiger.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14Dr9Io&via=Digg&text=Feeding Time
